content.title: Dr. D.S. Kothari Research Grant For Newly Recruited Faculty Members
content.details: The scheme 'Dr. D.S. Kothari Research Grant for Newly Recruited Faculty Members' is a research grant scheme by the University Grants Commission (UGC), Department of Higher Education (DoHE). The purpose of the research grant is to provide opportunities to regularly appointed faculty members of Universities/ Institutes/ Colleges to pursue research in their area(s). All teachers who are newly appointed at the level of Assistant Professor against permanent posts in the university shall be eligible to receive financial support under the scheme. The Assistant professor should possess a Ph.D. degree with a minimum of five (5) research papers to his / her credit, published in journals of international repute. There are 132 slots, and the tenure is 2 years. The quantum of support under the scheme is ₹ 10,00,000.
benefits: Grant can be utilized for purchasing items like minor equipment, consumables, contingencies, fieldwork, travel, etc.
eligibility: Faculty members regularly appointed and working in universities, deemed-to-be-universities, institutions fully funded by Central or State Governments, and institutions of National Importance.
Newly appointed teachers at the level of Assistant Professor against permanent posts in the university.
Assistant professor should possess a Ph.D. degree with a minimum of five (5) research papers published in journals of international repute.
Assistant Professor should apply for the grant within a period of two years from the date of joining the post.
exclusions: The grant cannot be used for international travel, purchasing furniture items, or for appointing a project assistant or research fellow.
content.application_process: Online applications are invited once a year through advertisements in leading newspapers & employment news. Registration is required on the UGC website.
documents_required: Scanned copy of your passport-size photograph and signature (size upto 1 MB, format: jpg).
Complete Research proposal (size upto 5 MB) and an abstract (size upto 1 MB).
Auto-generated form signed by the HoD/Registrar.

faqs.question: What Is Meant By 'Aadhaar Seeding'?
faqs.answer: The fellowship is directly paid to the research scholars in their bank accounts. For this, the bank account numbers of the scholars are required to be Aadhaar linked and verified.

faqs.question: Does Only The Submission Of An Application Form Guarantee The Award Of A Fellowship And Research Grant?
faqs.answer: No, mere submission of an application form does not guarantee the award of a Fellowship and Research Grant.

faqs.question: Can I Apply Offline For The Research Grant?
faqs.answer: No. You need to visit the official website to apply.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No. The entire application process is completely free of cost.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Tenure Of The Research Grant?
faqs.answer: The tenure of the research grant shall be 2 years.
